definition[0]: to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere, especially while fighting in a war
example[0]: The rich provinces of Asia Minor were plundered by the invaders.
definition[1]: to use up all or most of the supplies of something in a careless way
example[1]: Unlicensed fishermen have plundered tuna stocks.
example[2]: the egotism of man as he plunders our planet
definition[2]: things that have been stolen during a violent attack, especially during a war
example[3]: Henry’s army returned loaded down with plunder.
definition[4]: to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere
example[5]: When President, he plundered much of his country’s wealth.
definition[5]: large amounts of money or property that have been stolen
example[6]: The army returned loaded down with plunder.
example[7]: The dictator’s fortune was amassed during three decades of plunder of his own country.
